result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian R. Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. ** Court directs Drug Buy Reimbursemnt Money in the amount of $360.00 is to be joint/several with co-defendants**
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Neely Stroede and/or Julie Shackelford.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes:
with Huber. No Good Time Credit. Court grants jail term to be served while defendant is attending the MSDF program-upon completion-defendant will return to the jail to complete the remainder of the sentence
Concurrent with: ATR sentence at MSDF.

records.addlTxt: 11:02 am cases called-16CF16 & 16CF127. Defendant Christian R. Walker in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson (16CF16) & attorney Ben Szilagyi (16CF127).  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader regarding resolution on all matters. Attorney Johnson & Szilagyi concur. Defendant concurs. Court addresses preliminary hearing on 16CF16-Defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause, and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Johnson confirms receipt and waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Counts 1, 3, & 4 of 16CF16 and No Contest to Count 1 of 16CF127.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 16CF16, repeater enhancers on Count 1, 3, & 4 of 16CF16 and Counts 2 & 3 of 16CF127.  Statement by defendant. Statement by court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: 16CF16-SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: COUNT 1 of 16CF16-8 months WCJ, with Huber-No Good Time Credit. Concurrent to ATR sentence at MSDF. Credit for 53 days served. Court premits jail to be served while attending the MSDF program-upon completion of program-defendant will be transferred to jail to complete remainder of sentence. CONDITIONS ON ALL COUNTS of 16CF16: AODA and follow through. Absolute Sobriety, No Bars, No Rx w/o valid Rx from physician. No contact with co-defendants-Neely Stroede and/or Julie Shackelford. Full-time gainful employment. Costs to include $360.00 Drug Buy Reimbursement Money. Drug Buy Reimbursement joint/several with co-defendants. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Terms of Agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. 16CF127- SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. Concurrent to any other sentence. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through. Absolute Sobriety, No Bars, No Rx w/o valid Rx from physician. No contact with co-defendants-Neely Stroede and/or Julie Shackelford. Full-time gainful employment. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Terms of Agent. Restitutuion in the amount of $350 with defendant having a right to contest restitutuion within 60 days. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:36 am case called-16CF127. Defendant Christian R. Walker in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Christian R. Walker in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion filed by Attorney Szilagyi regarding bond modification. DA Blader objects to bond modification. Attorney Szilagyi makes statement to court regarding request to modify bond and ATR possibility through DOC. Court questions defendant regairding charges in which ATR is being offered. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi regarding treatment during MSDF.  Further discussion between counsel and court.  Court makes statement regarding 16CF16. 16CF127-effective August 18, 2016 the court amends bond to $5000 Sign bond with conditions & transported by DOC from WSCD and MSDF. Defendant to remain confined in the MSDF substance abuse program as an ATR. Upon completion or discharge the previously imposed cash bond will be re-instated and the defendant will be returned to the Waushara County Jail. Court directs notice for 16CF16 to be set for a scheduling conference. Statement by DA Blader-offer will be sent for potential global resolution.  Statement by Attorney Szilagyi regarding potential resolution on 16CF16-defendant has expressed to him his interest in accepting the offer-however, Attorney Johnson is still attorney of record. Court sets matters for Plea/sentencing hearing and DA Blader states he will discuss with Attorney Johnson.

12:12 pm case called. Defendant Christian R. Walker in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Defendant Christian R. Walker in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Johnson-will be withdrawing from this matter and the defendant will need to apply to SPD for appointment of successor counsel. Court makes statement regarding substitution of attorney and requests motion and order be filed. This matter will track along with 16CF16.

3:41 pm cases called. 16CF16 & 16CF127. Defendant Christian R. Walker in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF127-  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Statement by Attorney Johnson regarding counsel and this matter. Court refers the defendant to SPD regarding counsel. Adjourns Initial Appearance. Bond modification request by Attorney Johnson. ADA Anderson requests bond to remain as ordered. Court respectfully declines to modify bond at this time and makes statement regarding request.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 26, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on July 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Johnson requesting a STC that coincides with the IA on the newly filed case.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on June 27, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Johnson makes statement requesting status.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on May 31, 2016 at 10:10 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court, appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STC adjourned as requested.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 10:10 am.
Status conference on April 20, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Johnson requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
State's
Status conference at 03-28-2016 03:20 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department by the next return to Court due to mechanical issues at the Waushara Co Jail

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:07 PM: Defendant Christian R. Walker in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   ADA argues for Signature Bond w/conditions.  Argument as to bond by Atty Johnson, agrees with Signature Bond request.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:20 pm.
